info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...AREAS OF SMOKE IN CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... Smoke, some of it dense at times, will reduce the visibility to as low as a quarter mile across the region through tonight. This smoke originates from Canada wildfires and will move from northwest to southeast behind a cold front currently sweeping through the state, and linger through tomorrow morning. Already, reports have been streaming in of very poor visibility and a very bad smell. The smoke is then expected to diminish throughout the day tomorrow into the evening. Motorists should be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities, and should use extra caution traveling. Use low beam headlights and be extra cautious at intersections and railroad crossings. People with a respiratory condition should be prepared for very poor air quality over the nest 12 to 24 hours.
